title: Narayana Murthy speaks out on AI impact: Encourages India youth to stay calm amid white-collar job worries
description: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy has addressed growing concerns over the impact of artificial intelligence on white-collar employment, urging India’s youth to remain calm and adaptable.
content: After his earlier comments about long working hours sparked debate, Infosys founder Narayana Murthy is now speaking to young Indians about something even bigger, which is artificial intelligence. His latest message is simple: don’t be scared of AI, a... [2379 chars]

title: ET AI Awards & Conclave 2025: Meet the Leadership Award winners shaping India’s AI decade
description: The ET AI Awards & Conclave 2025 recognised the leaders defining Indias artificial intelligence momentum. title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - Controversy Erupts Over Youth Congress 'Shirtless Protest' at AI Summit
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. title: PM Modi concludes historic visit to Israel as ties set to be upgraded to special strategic partnership
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday concluded his historic visit to Israel, which came after nine years, during which both countries agreed to elevate bilateral ties to a special strategic partnership. The visit saw the signing of 27 agreements spanning innovation, cultural exchange, manufacturing, artificial intelligence and other sectors.

description: Artificial intelligence chip designer Broadcom said that it expects to sell at least 1 million chips by 2027 based on its stacked design tech, an executive told Reuters on Wednesday.

title: Global debt hits record $348 tn as defence, AI spending surge
description: Global debt ballooned by nearly $29 trillion last year to touch a record $348 trillion, as governments ramped up spending on defence, national security and artificial intelligence-linked infrastructure
